author: Dr Matthew Green
title: The surprising history of London's lost tobacco houses
text: London The surprising history of Londonâ€™s lost tobacco houses Considered a cure for cancer, ripped-off fingernails and more, smoking in times of yore was a debonair delight practised throughout London; if you know where to look, a tour brings the history of the capital's tobacco houses back to life An 1857 illustration shows gentlemen in a London tobacconist shop Photo: Chronicle / Alamy By Dr Matthew Green
